title: Strictly's Dianne Buswell begs fans to stop sending death threats to Shirley Ballas
text:
Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Strictly 's Dianne Buswell has pleaded with angry fans to stop tweeting “death threats” to Shirley Ballas.

Dance pro Dianne and Radio 1 DJ Dev Griffin were axed in a shock elimination last week.

After fans took their anger out on head judge Shirley, 59, Dianne tweeted: “Guys this is terrible you can not be bullying like this. It’s awful and really upsets me to hear this.”

Dianne, 30, and Dev, 34, went out after the judges saved Aljaz Skorjanec, 29, and Emma Weymouth, 33, in a dance-off.

After the abusive tweets, a fan begged Dianne “please sort your fans out”, adding: “Sending vile abusive tweets and death threats to Shirley Ballas is totally out of order.”

Hundreds of fans complained to the BBC One show, accusing the judges of underscoring.

It has been announced that Luba Mushtuk, 29, and Dianne will join The Professionals tour next year.
description: Dance pro Dianne and Radio 1 DJ Dev Griffin were axed in a shock elimination last week which sparked evil death threats
